intro: Gymnosporia schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's burr bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by distinctive, spiny pods. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy shrub. Gymnosporia schliebenii is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine by local communities.
